alert.note: Alert for Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 6:40PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Baker and south central Charlton Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 639 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Taylor, or 17 miles southeast of Fargo, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Taylor. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
